metadata.title: CVE-2021-4083 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A read-after-free memory flaw was found in the Linux kernel's garbagecollection for Unix domain socket file handlers in the way users callclose() and fget() simultaneously and can potentially trigger a racecondition. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system or escalatetheir privileges on the system. This flaw affects Linux kernel versionsprior to 5.16-rc4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1003-starfive - 5.19.0-1003.4
No subscription required
